greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Compound filter: a(n) = T(A257993(n), A046523(n)), where T(n,k) is sequence A000027 used as a pairing function.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[(2 + (#1 + #2)^2 - #1 - 3 #2)/2 - Boole[n == 1] & @@ {Module[{i = 1}, While[! CoprimeQ[Prime@ i, n], i++]; i], Times @@ MapIndexed[ Prime[First@ #2]^#1 &, Sort[FactorInteger[n][[All, -1]], Greater]]}, {n, 92}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, May 04 2017 *)
program: A046523(n) = { my(f=vecsort(factor(n)[, 2], , 4), p); prod(i=1, #f, (p=nextprime(p+1))^f[i]); };  \\ This function from _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Aug 17 2011
from sympy import factorint, prime, primepi, gcd
def T(n, m): return ((n + m)**2 - n - 3*m + 2)/2
return sorted([f[i] for i in f])
def a(n): return T(a257993(n), a046523(n)) # _Indranil Ghosh_, May 05 2017
xref: Differs from A286143 for the first time at n=24, where a(24) = 328, while A286143(24) = 355.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, May 04 2017
